item.title: Report X-2024010772
item.description:
Report X-2024010772

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The plastic bucket was found damaged in the load area and moved to the hazmat cage for reports. DescribePack: The outer plastic bucket looks like it was crushed, ripping open the side of the bucket and spilling out some of the tabs inside. One of the tabs was ripped, and nine more were missing. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The bucket and tabs were collected and put into a hazbag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2024020463
item.description:
Report X-2024020463

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-23
  • City: DEFUNIAK SPRINGS
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg. received off trailer 818689 out of 308-SANC, damaged. Pkg. taken to QA for inspection. DescribePack: Upon inspecting contents, it was noted that a 1 gallon can had an open lid, causing paint to leak out, around 12 oz. There were 2, 1 gallon cans and 4. 2 quart cans in pkg. The pkg. had orientation arrows on it, the gallon cans were placed in plastic bags with no clips, just the plastic ring that keeps the lid from opening. There were Styrofoam peanuts inside to cover the 4 small cans. The DPR states 16 damages, it was only 1, fat fingered. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. sitting in HMPA awaiting instructions from PGH.

item.title: Report X-2024020385
item.description:
Report X-2024020385

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-19
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was going up the conveyer belt on 1300 around 6:30 a.m. when a PH noticed that it was leaking. PH removed the package to a safe area where it would not leak and away from everyone. Once QA got to the facility at 6:45 a.m., the manager let QA know about the package. DescribePack: Cap broke on the jerrican container. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Removing the package from the vanlines and into a safe area.

item.description:
Report X-2024010776

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-07T15:11:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: OCALA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Corrosive hazmat package was found wet & torn. Upon inspection found 1 bottle of Nu-brite condenser cleaner 1-gallon had loose lid resulted to leakage. DescribePack: Bottle had loose lid resulted to leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2024010754
item.description:
Report X-2024010754

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-07T15:11:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: WEST PALM BEACH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was unloaded from a trailer and placed on a conveyer belt. The package was then sent down the chute causing the cap to be punctured and leaked liquids. Package was discovered inside of the chute and placed in red hazmat bin and lined with a plastic bag. DescribePack: The 2 inches white piece under the cap was punctured and the liquids leaked inside the fiberboard box, causing it to rip. DurationRel: 24 and MitigateEffect: The package was removed from the chute and placed in a lined red hazmat bin. It was placed in well ventilated area.

item.title: Report X-2024010752
item.description:
Report X-2024010752

  • Description: SequenceEvent: JERRICAN WAS FOUND TO BE WET ON THE BOTTOM. PLACED IN TOTE FOR QA. DescribePack: INSPECTION FOUND AN ABRASION NEAR THE BOTTOM OF THE JERRICAN THAT WAS ALLOWING LEAKAGE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED IN TOTE, REMOVED FROM AREA OF OTHER PACKAGES.

item.title: Report X-2024020050
item.description:
Report X-2024020050

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-07T15:11:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-23
  • City: LAKELAND
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PRODUCT WAS FOUND ON THE FLOOR INSIDE THE HAZARDOUS MATERIAL HOLDINNG CELL WAITING FOR ETT PROCESSING AND OTHER CONFIRMATION FROM MANAGEMENT TO PROCCED. THIS PACKAGE HAD OUTER MARKING THAT REVEAL TO A HAZARDOUS MATERIAL, AND NO PACKING SLIP TO OR AUDIT PAPERS TO IDENTIFY THE ITEM. IT WAS PACKAGED INSIDE A USPS PRIORITY BOX PLACE AT THE CUSTOMER COUNTER WHICH FRONT DESK IMMEDIATELY WITH THE HOLD ITEM AND PROCCEED WITH THE APPROPIATE PRECAUTIONS HANDLING THE PACKAGE.
